solution_line_template: The {dog_age_human_years}-year-old dog ages {dog_to_human_ratio} years to one human year so he will technically be {dog_age_human_years}*{dog_to_human_ratio} = <<{dog_age_human_years}*{dog_to_human_ratio}={dog_age_dog_years}>>{dog_age_dog_years} years old in dog years
Max's dog will be {dog_age_dog_years} when Max turns {max_age} so the age difference is {dog_age_dog_years}-{max_age} = <<{dog_age_dog_years}-{max_age}={age_difference}>>{age_difference}
